New Records: Domantas Sabonis recorded 28 rebounds, making Kristaps Porzingis his 'bitch'.
Key Match Events: Sacramento Kings guard Malik Monk drove to the basket against Boston Celtics center Kristaps Porzingis in the first quarter.
The Kings outscored the Celtics 61-42 in the second half.
The Kings held the Celtics to under 100 points for only the second time this year.
Devan Clark scored 8 straight points at the beginning of the 4th quarter.
The Kings out-rebounded the Celtics 56-43 and had 17 points on fast breaks.
Pre-Game Insights: Many fans expected the Kings to lose badly but hoped they would at least play hard.
Post-Match Reflections: Fans expressed disbelief and joy over the Kings' victory.
The Kings' performance was compared to their 2022-23 season.
The victory was seen as a significant turnaround from the team's performance two weeks prior.
The Kings' defense was praised for holding the Celtics to under 100 points.
Domantas Sabonis was highlighted for his incredible performance.
Fans discussed the potential impact of De'Aaron Fox returning to the lineup.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Kings' victory was celebrated with chants of 'Light the Beam!'
The Kings' win streak was noted as the second longest current win streak in the league.
The Kings beat the Celtics in every statistical category.
